alert.note: Alert for Western Charlton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 2:18PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Nassau, northern St. Johns, southeastern Baker, northeastern Union, Duval and south central Charlton Counties this afternoon... Scattered thunderstorms were starting to develop across Baker, Charlton, Nassau and Duval counties around 2 15 pm. These storms will further develop as they drift east around 10 mph, and will collide with outflows and the sea breeze. Rapid intensification is expected and these storms will be capable of gusty winds of 40 to 50 mph and pockets of very heavy rainfall. Those in the metro Jacksonville area should consider seeking shelter indoors. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Jacksonville, Jacksonville International Arpt, Unf, Arlington, Ponte Vedra Beach, Neptune Beach, Macclenny, Glen St. Mary, Baymeadows and Cisco Gardens. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
